Instance.description: Zone director used to control the objects and interactions on the acting studio lot.

TunableList.name: lot_load_loot
TunableList.description: A mapping of Object IDs and loots to apply to those objects when the lot loads. This can be used for things like applying specific locks to door.

TunableList.name: loot
TunableList.description: A set of loots to apply to all objects with the specified tag.

TunableTuple.name: lock_door
TunableTuple.description: An operation that locks an object.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableEnum.name: clear_existing_locks
TunableEnum.description: Which locks should be cleared before adding the new lock data.

TunableTuple.name: lock_all_with_genus_exception
TunableTuple.description: Lock all Sims except those that match the tuned genus.

TunableVariant.name: ages
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableVariant.name: gender
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: specified
TunableEnum.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

TunableEnum.name: match_type
TunableEnum.description:
If MATCH_ALL is set, test will pass if Sim matches with all enabled tuned genus.
If MATCH_ANY is set, test will pass if Sim matches with one of the enabled tuned genus.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableVariant.name: species
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species.

TunableTuple.name: lock_all_with_simid_exception
TunableTuple.description: The lock data will reject anyone who's not in the exception sim id list.

Tunable.name: except_actor
Tunable.description: If we want this lock data to have this actor as exception sim.

Tunable.name: except_household
Tunable.description: If we want this lock data to have actor's household as exception sims.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableTuple.name: lock_all_with_situation_job_exception
TunableTuple.display: Lock All With Situation Job Exception

Tunable.name: except_business_employee
Tunable.description: If true, the business store employee will have exception to the door.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableTuple.name: situation_job_test
TunableTuple.description: The test to determine whether this sim can pass or not.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then the test result will be reversed, so it will test to see if they are not in a job or not in role state that has matching tags.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this situation job test.

TunableList.name: role_tags
TunableList.description: The participant must have a job that matches the role_tags or have the situation_job.

TunableList.name: situation_jobs
TunableList.description: The participant must have this job in this list or a job that matches the role_tags.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: lock_ranked_statistic
TunableTuple.description: The lock data represent ranked statistic test. Sim that can pass the the ranked statistic test on the data can pass this lock.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

TunableTuple.name: rank_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Sims that have ranked statistic's value inside the threshold are not locked by the portal.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The number that describes the threshold.

Tunable.name: ranked_stat
Tunable.description: The ranked statistic we are operating on. Sims won't be allowed to traverse if they don't have this statistic.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

Tunable.name: replace_same_lock_type
Tunable.description: If True, it will replace the same type of lock data in the locking component, otherwise it will update the existing data.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableEnum.name: object_tag
TunableEnum.description: All objects with this tag will have the tuned loot applied on lot load..

TunableList.name: performance_objects
TunableList.description: A mapping of performance objects (i.e. lights, green screen, vfx machine) and the state they should be put into when the performance starts/stops.

TunableTuple.name: performance_object_states
TunableTuple.description: States that should be applied to the objects before, during, and after the performance. If the object doesn't have the necessary state then nothing will happen.

TunableList.name: performance_states
TunableList.description: States to set on the object when the performance starts.

Tunable.description: A state value to set on the object.

TunableList.name: post_performance_states
TunableList.description: States set on the object when the performance is over.

Tunable.description: A state value to set on the object.

TunableList.name: pre_performance_states
TunableList.description: States to set on the object when the zone loads.

TunableTuple.description: A state to set on an object as well as a perk that will skip setting the state.

TunableVariant.name: skip_with_perk
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows skipping this state change if the active Sim has a tuned perk.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If the active Sim has this perk, this state won't be set on the tuned objects. For instance, if the Sim has the Established Name perk, they don't need to use the hair and makeup chair. This can prevent those objects from glowing in that case.

Tunable.name: state_value
Tunable.description: A state value to set on the object.

TunableEnum.name: performance_object_tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag for the performance object.

TunableTuple.name: post_performance_time_between_wrap_and_lights
TunableTuple.display: Post Performance Time Between Wrap And Lights
TunableTuple.description: How long after the "that's a wrap" sound until the post-performance state should be swapped on all the objects (lights, greenscreen, etc.)

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

TunableTuple.name: post_performance_time_remaining
TunableTuple.description:
This is how long the gig should last once the player completes the final interaction. Regardless of how long the timer shows, once the player finishes the final interaction, we'll set the gig to end in this tuned amount of time.
Note: This should be enough time to encompass both the Post Performance Time To Wrap Callout and Post Performance time Between Wrap And Lights time spans.

Tunable.name: hours
Tunable.description: Number of hours

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

TunableTuple.name: post_performance_time_to_wrap_callout
TunableTuple.display: Post Performance Time To Wrap Callout
TunableTuple.description: How long, after the Player completes the entire gig, until the "That's a wrap" sound should play.

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

TunableList.name: stage_marks
TunableList.description: A mapping of stage marker tags to the interactions that should be added to them for this gig. These interactions will be applied to the stage mark/object on zone load.

TunableList.name: scene_interactions
TunableList.description: The set of interactions that will be added to the stage mark object.

Tunable.description: A Super Interaction that should be added to the stage mark object.

TunableEnum.name: stage_mark_tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag for the stage mark object the tuned scene interactions should be on.

Tunable.name: start_performance_interaction
Tunable.description: A reference to the interaction that indicates the performance is starting. This is what triggers all of the state changes in the Performance Object tuning.

TunableTuple.name: thats_a_wrap_audio
TunableTuple.description: The sound to play when the player has completed the performance and the Post Performance Time To Wrap Callout time has passed.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.
